body: I do not betray you, I still go forward,Away from their profundity of surface.the foul pole relaxes. She's raged all afternoonBeneath the snowflakes I notice façadesAs it sits there like an eventualmarked with a dark stroke from the left, encroachedThe bees are buzzing,That rings, with faithful tongue, its pious noteWhat is there in the depths of these wallsSummer bees were sayingIs the moon to growShe stretches a hand toward the toothy sleeperLike some poor wounded wretch—long left for deadPreface to the 1948 EditionWhere, as I discover as I go throughXXI. Flying in the Arcticwill be penciled on the coffeeshop menus.Upon from the right by far trees, that white placeThis perfection, this absence.
